p: During the evaluations, all vegetation in the 2 m radius of M. calvescens sampled during the population dynamics experiment was also observed to check whether the Lepidoptera species had attacked other plant species. Among the species found close to M. calvescens, other Melastomataceae were found. The most common were as follows: Clidemia capitellata ( Bonpl.) D. Don., Clidemia hirta (L.) Don, Leandra lacunosa Cogn, Miconia albicans (Sw.) Triana, M. mendoncaei Cogn., Miconia ibaguensis (Bonpl.), and Ossala confertiflora (DC). Organs of these species were carried to the laboratory to determinate whether Lepidoptera larvae were present inside.
